content: As the Tabilan continue hostilities in Afghanistan...and seek to arouse the conservative populace in Pakistan...Iran continues to seek International attention by way of their nuclear arms and ballistic missile ventures. I saw on the news recently that they have scheduled a meeting...Iran, Pakistan and Afghanistan. What do you think is being discussed???
reply: As the Tabilan continue hostilities in Afghanistan...and seek to arouse the conservative populace in Pakistan...Iran continues to seek International attention by way of their nuclear arms and ballistic missile ventures. I saw on the news recently that they have scheduled a meeting...Iran, Pakistan and Afghanistan. What do you think is being discussed???
title: Afghanistan and Pakistan...and the reticent Iranians.

content: I'd bet the United States and Taliban come up frequently as topics of conversation. It seems the worm may be turning in Pakistan against the Taliban. Important segments of the Pakistani populace have been turned off by Sharia law and now see the Taliban as a personal, rather than abstract threat. Iran is probably trying to get some bargaining chips for upcoming talks with the U.S..

content: Well, whatever all of these actors decide to talk about or do is of no concern in Israel...They're on their own time line, not President Obama's.
reply: Well, whatever all of these actors decide to talk about or do is of no concern in Israel...They're on their own time line, not President Obama's.
title: Afghanistan and Pakistan...and the reticent Iranians.

content: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: Well, whatever all of these actors decide to talk about or do is of no concern in Israel...They're on their own time line, not President Obama's. Israel is going to put it's national interest first but their stated policy of being the only kid on the block with nukes is going to have to be reexamined since that genie is way out of the box. The United States and Israel playing Good Cop, Bad Cop could yield dividends. If Iran does get a nuke and acts a fool, there won't be anybody left to enjoy the resurrection of the hidden Caliph. Despite what many think, the Iranians are not completely insane.
quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: Well, whatever all of these actors decide to talk about or do is of no concern in Israel...They're on their own time line, not President Obama's.
reply: Israel is going to put it's national interest first but their stated policy of being the only kid on the block with nukes is going to have to be reexamined since that genie is way out of the box. title: Afghanistan and Pakistan...and the reticent Iranians.

content: quote: Originally posted by Yooper_tj: quote: Originally posted by Thud357L: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: Well, whatever all of these actors decide to talk about or do is of no concern in Israel...They're on their own time line, not President Obama's. Israel is going to put it's national interest first but their stated policy of being the only kid on the block with nukes is going to have to be reexamined since that genie is way out of the box. The United States and Israel playing Good Cop, Bad Cop could yield dividends. If Iran does get a nuke and acts a fool, there won't be anybody left to enjoy the resurrection of the hidden Caliph. Despite what many think, the Iranians are not completely insane. Great observations. It's easy to overlook (or just plain ignore) that Iran is a relatively modern society as it goes in that part of the world. They work, they worship, they shop, they love their ice cream; they hold something very much like free and fair elections, and many are trying to implement changes to draconian social policies at the polls. Can you imagine being a modern urbane society with a foot-in-the-mouth megalomaniac president surrounded by morons who take all their cues from the religious right? [sarcasm]I didn't think so...[/sarcasm] The real value of a nuke is as a threat. Like the Godfather said, a threat is no good if you have to use it. The first guy to use a nuke in today's world digs two graves - one for the other guy and one for himself. The only time nukes have been used is when we were the only ones that had them. The old Soviet Union was just as fanatical as any state existing today but when the chips are down, fanaticism has always given way to pragmatism. Iran will be pragmatic. Al Qeda might not be pragmatic at all but no state is going to back these guys with a nuke since that hand could not be hidden. Doesn't mean they can't get a nuke and it doesn't mean they won't but I don't lose sleep over Iran. The dynamics in Pakistan are a different story but if they don't lose their country, all is well. Mostly. International terrorists are a definite threat to the world. Always has been, always will be.

The old Soviet Union was just as fanatical as any state existing today but when the chips are down, fanaticism has always given way to pragmatism. Iran will be pragmatic. Al Qeda might not be pragmatic at all but no state is going to back these guys with a nuke since that hand could not be hidden. Doesn't mean they can't get a nuke and it doesn't mean they won't but I don't lose sleep over Iran. The dynamics in Pakistan are a different story but if they don't lose their country, all is well.
